intro: Scandix pisidica, commonly known as the Piszczak, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Scandix pisidica is often found in moist, calcareous soils along riverbanks and in woodland edges. It is valued both for its ornamental appeal and for its historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
